original text: a push for greater effort…
suggested edit: a push for greater efforts

original text: This push has come at the national level…
suggested edit: This push can be seen at the national level…

original text: ...with the One Big Beautiful Bill Act of 2025, which included new accountability measures…
suggested edit: …with the One Big Beautiful Bill Act of 2025, which includes new accountability measures…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: I suppose the measures are ongoing? Changed to "created" for clarity

original text: Outcomes-based funding (also known as "OBF"…
suggested edit: Outcomes-based funding (OBF)
rationale: AP Style is to introduce an acronym and use it from then on
notes: OBF is only referred to once here for a reason; we chose as a team not to use the acronym. Quotation marks are also OK in AP Stylebook when introducing an unfamiliar term

original text: …a term many states still use and which some may prefer.
suggested edit: …a term that many states still use and some may prefer.

original text: This brief defines these models …
suggested edit: This brief defines OBF models …
rationale: AP Style is to introduce an acronym and use it from then on
notes: OBF is only referred to once here for a reason; we chose as a team not to use the acronym

original text: ...models to include all funding formulas that have a direct, systematic link…
suggested edit: ...models as those that include funding formulas that have a direct systematic link…"
notes: the suggestion makes it more confusing?

original text: ... funding formulas that have a direct, systematic link…
suggested edit: ...funding formulas that have a direct systematic link…"
notes: AP Stylebook says to use commas between two equal adjectives, so this suggestion is wrong.

original text: Against this backdrop of heightened scrutiny and fiscal pressures…
suggested edit: Against this backdrop of heightened scrutiny and fiscal pressure…

original text: These funding models calculate state higher education funding…
suggested edit: These funding models calculate states' higher education funding…
notes: This suggestion changes the meaning of the sentence. State is a general adjective here (AP Stylebook recognizes it) and not a possessive.

original text: The lack of clarity may be attributed to several factors…
suggested edit: The lack of clarity can be attributed to several factors…
rationale: "may" is used in the sentence afterwards

original text: …a lack of clarity about shared goals and how those translate into specific funding mechanisms.
suggested edit: …a lack of clarity about shared goals and how they translate into specific funding mechanisms.

original text: …financial sufficiency to cover needs for under-resourced institutions…
suggested edit: financial sufficiency to cover the needs of under-resourced institutions…
rationale: makes it clearer that it is institutions' needs

original text: …accessible introduction to outcomes-based funding in state postsecondary finance.
suggested edit: …accessible introduction to outcomes-based funding for state postsecondary education.
notes: I think the specificity is relevant here.

original text: …synthesizes extant research…
suggested edit: …synthesizes existing research…

original text: …rather, it is a resource for anyone -- policymakers, advocates, funders, or others -- who seek to understand…
suggested edit: …rather, it serves as a resource for policymakers, advocates, funders, and others seeking to understand…

original text: …equip decision-makers with the knowledge needed to make informed decisions…
suggested edit: …equip decision-makers with the knowledge they need to make informed decisions…

original text: …"base-plus" model, in which IHEs' allocations start with…
suggested edit: …"base-plus" model, in which an IHE's allocations…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: copyeditor missed changing related subject "allocations" to "allocation" and predicate "start" to "starts"…

original text: …such as demographic trends, institutional initiatives, and personnel costs.
suggested edit: …such as demographic trends, institutional initiatives, or personnel costs.

original text: The base-plus approach….As a result, these models are often unresponsive…
suggested edit: The base-plus approach…As a result, models that use this approach are often unresponsive…
notes: Feels like a weird change -- it's more wordy this way

original text: Over time, many states have pivoted to use funding formulas…
suggested edit: Over time, many states have pivoted to using funding formulas…
notes: Creates two -ing words in a row?

original text: ... (and many with increasing numbers of inputs).
suggested edit: ... (many with increasing numbers of inputs).

original text: …and b) distribute funding in a fairer, more rational way.
suggested edit: …and b) distribute funds in a fairer, more rational way.
rationale: Helps to distinguish between funding used for "outcomes based funding" and funding in reference to specific money

original text: …(e.g., dollar rates per full-time equivalent (FTE) student)…
suggested edit: …(e.g., dollar rate per full-time equivalent (FTE) student)…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: edited to "e.g., dollars per…"

original text: enrollment-based funding calculated using full-time equivalent (FTE) enrollment, and…
suggested edit: enrollment-based funding calculated using FTE enrollment
rationale: acronym already defined above

original text: As of 2025, more than 30 states distribute some level of funding through an outcomes-based model.
suggested edit: As of 2025, more than 30 states distribute some amount of funding using outcomes-based models.

original text: …is not the main vehicle for appropriations…
suggested edit: …is not the main vehicle for appropriation…
rationale: Appropriation as a process is singular
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: I meant appropriations in terms of funds. Changed to "distributing appropriations"

original text: …use outcomes-based funding as a supplemental appropriation.
suggested edit: …use outcomes-based funding as a suuplemental form of appropriation.
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: not sure why this was necessary, but clarified to just "as a supplement."

original text: …determine outcomes-based funding totals through the appropriations process…
suggested edit: …determine outcomes-based funding totals through the appropriation process…
rationale: Appropriation refers to the act (aka process) of appropriating something

original text: Table: Examples of states with formulas that are majority outcomes-based.
suggested edit: Table 1: States with Formulas That Are Mainly Outcomes-Based
rationale: Tables and figures should be numbered and in title caps

original text: …outcomes (Table)…
suggested edit: …outcomes (Table 1)…
rationale: in-text references should match table

original text: …are outside institutions' control.
suggested edit: …are outstide the institutions' control.
notes: There aren't specific institutions we're referencing?

original text: …(e.g., funding floor, hold-harmless provisions)
suggested edit: …(e.g., funding floor or hold-harmless provisions)

original text: …during the early years of implementation.
suggested edit: …during the early years of their implementation.

original text: …implementation considerations are critical to seeing policy success.
suggested edit: …implementation considerations are critical to policy success.

original text: Policymakers interested in outcomes-based funding often hold common goals.
suggested edit: Policymakers interested in outcomes-based funding often have common goals.

original text: …choose to use outcomes-based funding to distribute appropriations.
suggested edit: …choose to use outcomes-based models to distribute funds.
notes: I think the specificity is relevant here.

original text: …such as Indiana's four-year formula, reward completions in high-priority fields such as STEM,
suggested edit: …such as Indiana's four-year formula, reward completion in high-priority fields such as STEM,
notes: It does not reward just completion, it rewards the number of completions.

original text: …reflecting the belief that aligning degree production with labor market demand…
suggested edit: …reflecting the belief that aligning degree completion with labor market demand…
notes: it's not about completion, it's about aligning production to demand; this reflects how the field views it

original text: The business community often advocates strongly for these workforce-aligned goals…
suggested edit: The business community often advocates strongly for such workforce-aligned goals…

original text: ...business leaders' preference…
suggested edit: ...business leaders’ preference
rationale: Add curly quotes
notes: why are curly quotes needed?

original text: …preference for applying performance-based accountability practices to public investments.
suggested edit: …preference for applying performance-based accountability to public investments.
rationale: "practices" isn't necessary here

original text: …have worked to design elements of funding adequacy into their…
suggested edit: …have worked to incorporate elements of funding adequacy into their…
rationale: "design…into…" is a bit clunky

original text: Evidence on the effectiveness of these models, however, remains mixed across different designs and implementations.
suggested edit: Evidence on the effectiveness of these models remains mixed across different designs and implementations.

original text: Across 12 quantitative evaluations of outcomes-based state models…
suggested edit: Across 12 quantitative evaluations of outcomes-based funding models…
rationale: "state" is confusing here

original text: …that states using these funding models did not outperform…
suggested edit: …that states that used these models did not outperform…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Not sure why we need to have two "that"'s so close together? Took the suggestion of eliminating "funding" though, since it was inserted above

original text: Others have documented limited impact on credential attainment…
suggested edit: Others have documented a limited impact on credential attainment…
notes: Not sure why it's necessary?

original text: There could be several potential explanations…
suggested edit: There are several potential explanations…
rationale: Redundancy between "could be" and "potential"

original text: If the metrics selected do not align with…
suggested edit: If the selected metrics do not align with…

original text: …then an outcomes-based model will fail to move the needle.
suggested edit: …then an outcomes-based model will fail to make a meaningful impact.
rationale: Avoid idioms
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion

original text: …investigating just one outcome metric -- certificate awards -- found substantial variation…
suggested edit: …investigating just one outcome metric, certificate awards, found substantial variation…
rationale: AP Stylebook prefers to use em dashes as little as possible

original text: …variation in how states defined it and used that metric for funding allocations.
suggested edit: …variation in how states defined and used it for allocating funds.
rationale: unnecessary extra words

original text: Combined across multiple different metrics and state contexts, this diversity makes it difficult to truly compare the effectiveness across outcomes-based funding models.
suggested edit: When viewed across multiple metrics and state contexts, this variation makes it difficult to truly compare the effectiveness of outcomes-based models.
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: changed to "this variation makes it difficult to truly understand the effectiveness of outcomes-based funding — both as an approach per se, and across multiple designs."

original text: …these formulas may serve as a strategy…
suggested edit: …these formulas may be used as a strategy…

original text: Sidebar: Outcomes-Based Funding as a Policy Tool
suggested edit: Sidebar 2: Outcomes-Based Funding as a Policy Tool
rationale: sidebar and table numbering

original text: However, poor performance can also be the result of insufficient…
suggested edit: However, poor performance can be the result of insufficient resources…
rationale: unnecessary word

original text: …what is the appropriate state role in boosting student outcomes?
suggested edit: …what is the appropriate role of the state in boosting student outcomes?

original text: …there is the question of whether financial incentives are the right mechanism…
suggested edit: …there is the question of whether the use of financial incentives is the right mechanism…
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: …government operates differently from business contexts…
suggested edit: government operates differently from business…
rationale: unnecessary word

original text: …such as narrowing focus to only what is measured, gaming the system, or neglecting harder-to-serve populations.
suggested edit: …such as a narrowed focus on only what is measured, gaming of the system, or neglect of harder-to-serve populations.
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: …some stakeholders may be rightfully skeptical of outcomes-based funding models, but they are still appealing…
suggested edit: …some stakeholders may be rightfully skeptical of outcomes-based funding models; however, they are still appealing…
rationale: break up long sentence

original text: …to many state policymakers who have limited…
suggested edit: …to many state policymakers, who have limited…
rationale: AP Stylebook says to use commas for nonessential clauses
notes: Author choice: it's grammatically a nonessential clause, but meaninfully significant.

original text: Regulating funding is one of the must signficant levers…
suggested edit: Funding regulation is one of the most significant levers…
notes: "Funding regulation" is an awkward phrase

original text: "return on public investment"
suggested edit: “return on public investment”
rationale: Add curly quotes
notes: still not sure why curly quotes are necessary?

original text: Businesses highlight the need for a skilled workforce and filling talent shortages…
suggested edit: Businesses highlight the need for a skilled workforce and for filling talent shortages…
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: …increased opportunities both for historically marginalized groups and…
suggested edit: …increased opportunities for both historically marginalized groups and…
rationale: Move "both" closer to what it's referencing

original text: …create challenges for policymakers designing outcomes-based funding models.
suggested edit: …create challenges for policymakers when designing outcomes-based funding models.
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: …such as earnings premiums…
suggested edit: …such as earning premiums…
notes: The suggestion introduces confusion. The premium is on earnings (aka wages), versus "earning a premium"

original text: Narrow definitions of ROI… are easier to measure and communicate, but they risk…
suggested edit: Narrow definitions of ROI… are easier to measure and communicate, but risk…
notes: Technically the suggestion violates AP Stylebook, but the comma is required for clarity so *shrug*

original text: Broader definitions capture the full range of returns but…
suggested edit: Broader definitions may capture the full range of returns but…
rationale: Soften claim

original text: …promoting critical, but lower-earning fields…
suggested edit: ...promoting critical but lower-earning fields…
rationale: comma unnecessary

original text: …what is most relevant, high-priority, and applicable in their state context.
suggested edit: …what is most relevant, high priority, and applicable in their state context.
rationale: hyphen unnecessary when it comes after a noun, even when acting as an adjective.

original text: …about what "outcomes" and "return on investment" mean…
suggested edit: …about what “outcomes” and “return on investment” mean…
rationale: Add curly quotes

original text: …multiple dimensions that allow for different configurations depending on a state's priorities…
suggested edit: …multiple dimensions that allow for different configurations depending on the state's priorities…
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: Each aspect also includes an example…
suggested edit: Each description also includes an example…
rationale: Mismatched meaning

original text: These are not necessarily exemplars, but can help…
suggested edit: These are not necessarily exemplars, but they can help…

original text: …help to highlight…
suggested edit: …help highlight…
rationale: Remove unnecessary "to"

original text: At the end of this section is also a list of questions to guide…
suggested edit: At the end of this section is a list of questions to guide…
rationale: Remove unnecessary "also"

original text: …in designing an outcomes-based model is aligning stakeholders…
suggested edit: …in designing an outcomes-based model is to align stakeholders…
rationale: Too many gerunds close together

original text: …including too many metrics may blunt any incentive…
suggested edit: …including too many metrics could blunt any incentive…
rationale: "may" used in the sentence before already

original text: …as institutions spread their efforts thin trying to satisfy competing demands.
suggested edit: …as the institution spreads its efforts trying to satisfy competing demands.
notes: This would apply to all institutions funded, not sure why it needs to be singular

original text: Texas's
suggested edit: Texas’
rationale: Per AP Stylebook, singular proper nouns ending in S only use an apostrophe
notes: technically the copyeditors didn't catch this, I did. I only found it because they changed the apostrophe to curly though.

original text: …a major priority for Texas policymakers was increasing attainment as…
suggested edit: …a major priority for Texas policymakers was to increase attainment as…
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: The state's current formula for two-year colleges reflects this goal through…
suggested edit: The state's existing formula for two-year colleges reflected this goal…
notes: The suggestion is more confusing (existing versus current given the "redesign" context), and I don't understand why it has to be past tense?

original text: …through its primary outcome metric: credentials awarded.
suggested edit: …through its primary outcome metric, credentials awarded.
notes: Not sure the reasoning behind this edit, the AP Stylebook allows for using colons to emphasize something.

original text: However, not all credentials are treated equally.
suggested edit: However, not all credentials were treated equally.
notes: This is a current formula in operation today; I'm not sure why this has to be past tense.

original text: Awards are eligible to count for funding only if they are "credentials of value,"...
suggested edit: Awards were eligible to count for funding only if they are "credentials of value,"...
notes: This is a current formula in operation today; I'm not sure why this has to be past tense.

original text: ...Texas has created a direct connection between…
suggested edit: ...Texas created a direct connection between…
rationale: Remove unnecessary "has"

original text: …between its policy goals and its funding formula…
suggested edit: …between policy goals and the funding formula…
rationale: Remove extra possessive
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Changed to "between its policy goals and funding formula…"

original text: While traditional metrics like completion rates and time to degree…
suggested edit: While traditional metrics, such as completion rates and time to degreee,…
rationale: AP Style guidance says to use "like" for comparisons and "such as" for examples

original text: ….as stakeholders look for other ways to measure successfully achieving a goal.
suggested edit: …as stakeholders look for other ways to measure successful goal achievement.
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: realized "successful" and "achieving" are pretty much the same; edited to "other ways to measure state priorities."

original text: …standard outcomes-based metrics may not consider the full range….
suggested edit: …standard outcomes-based metrics might not consider the full range….

original text: …range of underserved grups, including adult learners, justice-impacted students, former foster youth, or students with disabilities.
suggested edit: …range of underserved grups, including adult learners, justice-impacted students, former foster youth, and students with disabilities.
notes: Changes the meaning -- we don't need all of them to be included in every formula, they are just suggestions.

original text: Data from Indiana shows that low-income and adult (25+) students have experienced larger declines in enrollment and completion than their comparison groups.
suggested edit: Data from Indiana shows larger declines in enrollment and completion among low-income and adult (25+) students than their comparison groups.
rationale: replace passive with active voice

original text: These patterns also reflect a broader context where Indiana's overall college-going rate decline is outpacting much of the nation…
suggested edit: These patterns also reflect a broader context in which the decline of Indiana's overall college-going rate is outpacing much of the nation…
rationale: improve flow

original text: By specifying these metrics, Indiana policymakers aimed to incentivize institutions to address these disparities and increase…
suggested edit: By specifying these metrics, Indiana policymakers aimed to incentivize institutions to address the disparities and increase…
rationale: "these" is repetitive twice

original text: This might include investing in student success or access programs, providing academic or career counseling, or speedy delivery of financial aid packages.
suggested edit: This might include investing in student success or access programs, providing academic or career counseling, or delivering financial aid packages speedily.
notes: Not sure why the extra words are necessary. It's "investing in" 3 things, not 3 things that all need different verbs.

original text: …the specific inputs and processes that must be included to achieve those results.
suggested edit: …the specific inputs and processes that must be included to achieve the desired results.
rationale: results were not specified earlier, so "those" was unclear

original text: Insitutions facing enrollment declines or changing demographics…
suggested edit: Insitutions facing declining enrollment or changing demographics
rationale: Parallelism

original text: Tennessee offers an example of how…
suggested edit: Tennessee is an example of how…
rationale: Someone offers an example to the reader, but the example does not offer itself?
notes: This is not in AP Stylebook

original text: …usual measures (e.g., completions, progression)…
suggested edit: …usual measures (e.g., completion and progression)…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: the metric is completions (number of) as opposed to just the milestone of completing something. Used "and" though

original text: …tied to maintaining good standing with accreditors as measured by external evaluations.
suggested edit: …tied to maintaining good standing with accreditors, as measured by external evaluations.
rationale: improve flow

original text: …greater social mobility…can be measured using individuals' lifetime earnings; however, it can also transform…
suggested edit: …greater social mobility…can be measured using individuals' lifetime earnings; it can also transform…
rationale: Not a contradictory phrase
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Point taken about unclear contradiction, edited to "…greater social mobility…is often measured using just individuals' lifetime earnings; however, that metric doesn’t capture additional long-term effects, such as transforming the trajectory of graduates’ children or breaking cycles of poverty across generations."

original text: Stakeholders might consider second-order, measurable effects…
suggested edit: Stakeholders might consider measuring second-order effects…

original text: …effects that are less tied to individual students. For example, …
suggested edit: …effects that are less tied to individual students; for example, …
notes: I think that would make that sentence so long and unwieldy.

original text: …research has shown that degree-holders rely less on social services…
suggested edit: …research has shown that degree-holders are less reliant on social services…

original text: …social services or direct fiscal benefits…
suggested edit: …social services and direct fiscal benefits…
notes: changes the meaning

original text: …in states where a significant amount of insitutional funding comes from local sources...
suggested edit: …in states where a significant portion of insitutional funding comes from local sources...
rationale: according to Merriam-Webster, "amount" refers to the total number or quantity

original text: …as a way to gain buy-in and show value for local constituents.
suggested edit: …as a way to gain buy-in and demonstrate value to local constituents.

original text: Michigan's two-year funding formula offers an example of…
suggested edit: Michigan's two-year funding formula is an example of…
rationale: Someone offers an example to the reader, but the example does not offer itself?
notes: This is not in AP Stylebook

original text: …an example of a creative metric measuring how institutions …
suggested edit: …an example of a creative metric that measures how institutions …
rationale: Could be misconstrued for "metric" as the noun of a subjective clause rather than a participial adj.

original text: …allocates 5% of formula funding to a "Local Strategic Value" component.
suggested edit: …allocates 5% of funding to local strategic value.
rationale: state documents refer to it in lowercase
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: took the lowercase but kept the quotes for 1) emphasis, given that it's the entire point of the example, and 2) because it's not well known and an immediate reference like that could be confusing.

original text: …four out of five "best practices"…
suggested edit: …four out of five best practices…
rationale: quotation marks not for quotations themselves are usually only used for irony or unfamiliar terms. Neither apply here.

original text: …best practices within three categories…
suggested edit: …best practices in three categories…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Edited to "within each of three categories…" to make the boundaries clearer

original text: Older outcomes-based models have largely focused on...
suggested edit: Older outcomes-based models primarily focused on...
notes: intentional present perfect tense: Some of the older models are still around (continuous tense)

original text: …focused on a limited set of metrics like completion rates and time to degree.
suggested edit: …focused on a limited set of metrics, such as completion rates and time to degree.
rationale: AP Style guidance says to use "like" for comparisons and "such as" for examples; also, nonessential clauses should always be set off by commas.

original text: …thoughtful experimentation with new approaches may better align funding…
suggested edit: …thoughtful experimentation with new approaches could better align funding…
rationale: "may" already used in the paragraph

original text: Different ways of calculating and distributing funding can also shape institutional behavior.
suggested edit: Different ways of calculating and distributing funding can shape institutional behavior.

original text: Different methods of calculation…
suggested edit: Different calculation methods…
rationale: eliminates extra preposition

original text: …can produce different funding allocations for institutions…
suggested edit: …can produce different funding allocation methods for institutions...
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: copyeditor suggestion changes the meaning -- it's the allocation per se. However, edited to say "different funding amounts for institutions..."

original text: Certain goals might be best met…
suggested edit: Certain goals may be best met…

original text: …be best met by weighting existing metrics, rather than adding new metrics -- for example, credentials…
suggested edit: …be best met by weighting existing metrics rather than adding new metrics; for example, credentials…
rationale: Em dash should not be used to separate a standalone independent clause

original text: …credentials awarded to first-generation students might have a premium…
suggested edit: …credentials awarded to first-generation students could carry a premium…
rationale: "may" already used above

original text: ... compared to other students.
suggested edit: ... compared to those of other students.
rationale: comparing to credentials awarded to other students

original text: Early research has found that premiums for science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) fields have led to increases in credentials in those fields.
suggested edit: Research has found that premiums for science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) fields have led to increased credentials in those fields.
rationale: conciseness
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: The word "early" is important -- this research is not necessarily a well-known conclusion. But the second edit was taken.

original text: …relies mainly on two outcome metrics: course completions and degree attainment.
suggested edit: …relies mainly on two outcome metrics: course completion and degree attainment.
notes: As mentioned earlier, it's completions to denote number of completions versus the process of completing something.

original text: Distribution methods -- or, how funding is allocated after metrics are calculated -- …
suggested edit: Distribution methods -- or how funding is allocated after metrics are calculated -- …
rationale: comma unnecessary since set off by em dashes

original text: In some states, funding is distributed…
suggested edit: In some states, funds are distributed…
rationale: Helps to distinguish between funding used for "outcomes based funding" and funding in reference to specific money

original text: This approach incentivizes cross-institution competition, which may drive higher outcomes but could also discourage statewide collaboration.
suggested edit: This approach incentivizes cross-institution competition, which can drive higher outcomes but also discourage statewide collaboration.

original text: …compare IHEs' current metrics against their past performance, to account for variety in institutional context.
suggested edit: …compare IHEs' current metrics against their past performance, to account for variations among institutional contexts.
rationale: precision in variety vs variations

original text: If institutions are competing against themselves, leaders may feel as though it is more realistic...
suggested edit: If institutions are competing against themselves, leaders may feel as though it is more realistic...
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: AP Stylebook says "as if" is the preferred form, but "as though" is acceptable, so just edited to "as if." There are already a lot of "that"'s

original text: …more realistic to drive increases in student outcomes, rather than competing with…
suggested edit: …more realistic to drive increases in student outcomes rather than compete with…
rationale: parallel verb tenses

original text: ...an IHE who might have different…
suggested edit: ...an IHE that might have different…
rationale: IHE is not a person

original text: The four-year formulas in Kentucky and Colorado offer a juxtaposition of two different approaches to distributing funding.
suggested edit: The four-year formulas in Kentucky and Colorado enable a comparison of two different approaches to funding distribution.
rationale: the example cannot offer itself?
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Clarified to "Kentucky and Colorado use different distribution methods in their four-year formulas, enabling a comparison of the two approaches."

original text: Kentucky's four-year formula uses the competitive approach: for each…
suggested edit: Kentucky's four-year formula uses the competitive approach: For each…
rationale: Capitalize after a colon if starting a new independent clause

original text: …for each of its five metrics…
suggested edit: …for each of five metrics…
notes: unsure why this is necessary

original text: …institutions earn funding based on their stare of the system-wide total volume of that metric.
suggested edit: …institutions earn funding based on their share of the total systemwide volume of that metric.
rationale: moving "total" up makes it clearer that it's an adjective. Also, AP Style says "systemwide," not "system-wide."
notes: found in an ask the editor response, not an official entry

original text: The advantage of this method is simplicity…
suggested edit: The advantage of this method is its simplicity…

original text: …the disadvantage is that institutions are competing with each other…
suggested edit: …the disadvantage is that institutions are competing with one another…
rationale: AP Style says to use "each other" for two parties, but "one another" for more than two. Either is acceptable for indefinite numbers.

original text: …including how much funding will ultimately be tied to outcomes calculations.
suggested edit: …including how much funding will ultimately be tied to outcome calculations.
rationale: Two plural nouns in a row makes it confusing?
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Changed to "outcome metrics" for clarity

original text: …further withholding of funds could only exacerbate the issues…
suggested edit: …further withholding of funds would only exacerbate the issues…
notes: This edit changes the meaning. We don't know for sure that it would exacerbate the issues, hence "could"

original text: …only exacerbate the issues rather than improving students' experiences and outcomes.
suggested edit: …only exacerbate the issues rather than improve students' experiences and outcomes.
rationale: "Improve" should mirror "exacerbate" in tense

original text: …gather a diverse set of stakeholders to holistically assess the current state of institutions' performance, students' experiences, and challenges facing both students and IHEs.
suggested edit: …gather a diverse set of stakeholders to holistically assess the current state of institutional performance, student experiences, and challenges facing both students and IHEs.
notes: It should be all institutions' collective performance; this edit could introduce a different connotation. Student doesn't need to be an adjective either? Not sure what was wrong with the possessives.

original text: …stakeholders should be involved throughout the design process, including through technical modeling, to give...
suggested edit: …stakeholders should be involved throughout the design process, including technical modeling, to give...
rationale: "throughout" and "through" repetitive
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Suggestion felt weird, changed to "including during technical modeling"

original text: …changes to the formula may impact funding levels and program choices.
suggested edit: …changes to the formula could impact funding levels and program choices.
notes: Not sure why this suggestion was made; "could" is already used two sentences above

original text: Policymakers might also consider implementation guardrails...
suggested edit: Policymakers might also consider implementing guardrails...
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: The guardrails are supposed to be during the implementation process only, not forever. Clarified to "consider temporary guardrails during early implementation…"

original text: …give IHEs time to align budgets and programs…
suggested edit: ...give IHEs time to align their budgets and programs…

original text: Only by tracking and analyzing change over time will stakeholders...
suggested edit: Only by tracking and analyzing changes over time will stakeholders...

original text: Only by …analyzing…over time...will stakeholders learn whether an outcomes-based funding model has achieved its goals.
suggested edit: Only by …analyzing…over time...will stakeholders be able to learn whether an outcomes-based funding model has achieved its goals.

original text: Oregon's recent redesign of its community college funding formula included an extended implementation timeline for stability as well as established review cycles.
suggested edit: Oregon's recent redesign of its community college funding formula includes an extended implementation timeline for stability and designated review cycles.
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Not sure why the switch to present tense? This redesign happened in 2023. But I did take the "designated" word change for review cycles

original text: …to add two student-focused components--Student Support and Student Success--prioritizing low-income and adult learners…
suggested edit: …to add two student-focused components -- student support and student success -- prioritizing low-income and adult learners…
rationale: AP Style adds spaces around em dashes, and minimalizes capitalization of anything that's not a proper noun.

original text: …prioritizing low-income, adult, career and technical education, and underrepresented learners…
suggested edit: …prioritizing low-income and adult students, those in career and technical education, and underrepresented learners...
rationale: better flow given that "career and technical education" is a weird adjective

original text: …with a long-run target of dedicating 10% of the Community College Support Fund (CCSF) to these areas.
suggested edit: …with a long-run target of 10% of the Community College Support Fund (CCSF) being dedicated to these areas.
notes: not sure why we'd opt for passive voice here

original text: …the state is phasing in the outcomes components over five years…
suggested edit: …the state is phasing in the outcomes component over five years…
rationale: There are two parts to the outcomes components, but one component itself.
notes: It could go either way, but for clarity keeping this

original text: …the outcomes-based component will stay a constant 10%...
suggested edit: …the outcomes-based component will be a constant 10%...
notes: not sure why we'd opt for passive voice here

original text: …a constant 10% of the total state appropriations.
suggested edit: a constant 10% of total state appropriations
notes: not sure why this is necessary

original text: …specifically to examine unintended consequences of the new formula,…
suggested edit: …specifically to examine any unintended consequences of the new formula,…

original text: ...after which reviews will continue every five years.
suggested edit: ...after which reviews will occur every five years.
rationale: "continue" implies ongoing, whereas the review will "occur" at a point in time.

original text: The multiyear timeline…
suggested edit: The multi-year timeline…
notes: this suggestion is wrong. AP Style Guide says that multi is one of the prefixes that does NOT take a hyphen

original text: …all signal thoughtful attention to stability...
suggested edit: …all signal thoughtful consideration of stability...
notes: not sure why this was necessary

original text: …can help guide discussion and decision-making:
suggested edit: …can help guide discussions and decision-making:

original text: Who have been the primary stakehodlers engaged in developing those goals?
suggested edit: Who have been the primary stakehodlers engaged in developing these goals?
notes: Changes the meaning? The goals are not discussed and are not ours, so unsure why this is necessary

original text: Are there disagreements about priorities, and how might those be addressed?
suggested edit: Are there disagreements about priorities? If so, how might they be addressed?

original text: Who are the key stakeholders that would be most impacted by a new funding model?
suggested edit: Which key stakeholders would be most impacted by a new funding model?
rationale: "that" should be replaced with "who," except "who" is already used in the question. Rephrase to avoid this issue entirely
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: The suggestion changes the question being asked, but point taken about grammar. Edited to just, "Who would be most impacted…"

original text: Is there existing interest in an outcomes-based funding approach?
suggested edit: Is there existing interest in using an outcomes-based funding approach?
notes: Not sure why it's necessary?

original text: …how much funding is appropriate for incentivizing behavior change…
suggested edit: …how much funding is appropriate for incentivizing behavioral change…
rationale: Behavior should be an adjective modifying "change"

original text: ...without adverse effects?
suggested edit: without causing adverse effects?
rationale: incentivizing isn't the predicate for both behavioral change and adverse effects; it needs a parallel verb in the present tense

original text: Tying too little funding to outcomes may fail to motivate change, while tying too much can create financial instability…
suggested edit: Tying too little funding to outcomes could fail to motivate change, while too much could create financial instability…
rationale: Eliminate repetitive "tying" and create a parallel with "could"

original text: Can the state's goals be captured in an outcomes-based funding framework?
suggested edit: Can the state's goals be captured within an outcomes-based funding framework?

original text: For these metrics, the next question is what data currently exists -- perhaps in a state's longitudinal data system, for example -- to capture…
suggested edit: For these metrics, the next question is what data currently exists, such as in a state's longitudinal data system, to capture…
notes: I feel like the suggestion is confusing

original text: …to capture that goal and set expectations…
suggested edit: …to capture the goal and set expectations…
did the team take the edit?: Edited but did not take suggestion
notes: Genuinely don't know what the difference is, but edited to "to capture the relevant goal and set…"

original text: What data infrastructure would be necessary to support the outcomes-based funding model?
suggested edit: What data infrastructure will be necessary to support the outcomes-based funding model?
rationale: AP Stylebook on subjunctive mood says, "In general, use the subjunctive if there is little likelihood that a contingency might come true."
notes: The hypothetical is intentional. States should be free to not use an OBF, so there is not necessarily a high likelihood that it will happen.

original text: …while avoiding an overwhelming number of measures that dilute focus.
suggested edit: …while avoiding an overwhelming number of measures, which can dilute focus.
rationale: AP Stylebook says to use "which" (and commas) with nonessential clauses.

original text: …decide whether to reward absolute performance, improvement, or some combination of both.
suggested edit: …decide whether to reward absolute performance, improvement, or a combination of both.
rationale: Only one combination = "a"; multiple possible combinations = "some"

original text: …transparent enough for IHEs to understand how their actions translate into funding yet sophisticated enough to account...
suggested edit: …transparent enough for IHEs to understand how their actions translate into funding, yet sophisticated enough to account...
rationale: Technically, AP Stylebook says not to use commas if the subject of the two clauses with a conjunction are the same and not repeated. But these clauses are very long, so a comma is probably helpful for the reader

original text: …differences in institutional context and student populations.
suggested edit: …differences in institutional contexts and student populations.
rationale: pluralize context to match "differences" and "populations"

original text: …the methods used to calculate and distribute funding…
suggested edit: …the methods used to calculate and distribute funds…
rationale: Helps to distinguish between funding used for "outcomes based funding" and funding in reference to specific money

original text: When designed and implemented poorly...
suggested edit: When poorly designed and implemented...

original text: …outcomes-based funding likely creates perverse incentives, exacerbates inequities, and fails to produce meaningful improvements…
suggested edit: …outcomes-based funding models likely create perverse incentives, exacerbate inequities, and fail to produce meaningful improvements…
rationale: given the context of poor design and implementation, models makes more sense than the overall concept. Also mirrors the next sentence, which uses "models"

original text: The contributions of these individuals and entities significantly enhanced our work; however, any errors in fact or analysis remain the responsibility of the authors.
suggested edit: The contributions of these individuals and entities significantly enhanced our work; any errors in fact or analysis remain the responsibility of the authors.
notes: Our acknowledgement section is a template; I don't think we should change this?

original text: Bellwether is a national nonprofit that exists to transform education to ensure systemically marginalized…
suggested edit: Bellwether is a national nonprofit that exists to transform education to ensure that systemically marginalized…
notes: About Bellwether is also a template…

original text: …we work hand in hand with education leaders…
suggested edit: …Bellwether works hand-in-hand with education leaders…
notes: About Bellwether is also a template…also the suggestion is wrong. It should not be hyphenated per AP Stylebook.
